fields.title: Login required
fields.text: You must be logged in to view this page. If you are making a purchase or registering for an event, please either log in or create a free account to complete your order.

fields.title: Job Post Form Instructions
fields.text:
You must submit your ad online and prepay with a credit card. APA does not accept ads received via fax or email. APA may edit your ad. Keep a record of your APA ID and password.

When you return to the APA website, use them to log in for access to your Job Admin Dashboard and online receipts.

fields.title: logged in but no access

fields.title: not logged in
fields.text: Please log in to the APA website before proceeding to that page.

fields.title: logged in, but not an APA member
fields.text: We’re sorry, you must be an APA member to view that page. Please join us! We’d love to have you.

fields.title: logged in, but not an AICP member
fields.text: We’re sorry, you must be a member of the American Institute of Certified Planners to view that page. Learn about AICP and the advantages of certification.

fields.title: logged in, but can’t see CM log
fields.text:
We’re sorry, but you do not have an active CM log. Let’s figure out what to do next.

If you are a new AICP member and this is your first time accessing your CM log

Your CM log may not be set up yet. Please contact AICP member service at 202-349-1016 or submit a request to AICP CM through our customer service form for assistance.

If your AICP membership has lapsed because of failure to fulfill CM requirements in a previous reporting period

Please contact AICP member service at 202-349-1016 or submit a request to AICP CM through our customer service form for assistance.

If your AICP membership has lapsed because of unpaid dues

Please contact APA customer service at 312-431-9100 or submit a request to membership through our customer service form for assistance making a dues payment.”

If none of these apply and you believe you received this message in error

Please contact AICP member service at 202-349-1016 or submit a request to AICP CM through our customer service form for assistance.

fields.title: logged in, but not a subscriber
fields.text: We’re sorry, but only subscribers may view that page. Learn more about the APA Knowledge Center and our subscription services.

fields.title: logged in, but not a chapter member
fields.text:
We’re sorry, but you must be a member of the chapter to view that page. Your APA chapter membership is determined by your primary address.

 

  • If you are an APA member and you recently moved to a different state, please contact APA customer service for assistance at 312-431-9100 or email customerservice@planning.org

 

To purchase an additional chapter membership, please contact APA customer service for assistance.

fields.title: Grace period message
fields.text: You are now in the grace period. You have until April 30, 2018, to complete your CM credit requirements.

fields.text: Resume search is accessible to employers for 3 months after the start date of their job posting. Please contact APA Customer Service for more details at customerservice@planning.org

fields.title: Salary Worksheet
fields.text:
As demonstrated by the data tables, numerous factors influence compensation levels. Tabular presentation, however, quickly exhausts even a large database such as this one when the joint effects of multiple factors (e.g., experience and education and employer) are considered simultaneously.

For this reason, an additional perspective on planner compensation is offered: a Salary Worksheet based on multiple regression statistical models that attempt to reliably predict approximate salary by accounting for the joint effects of the most influential variables.  In principle, such models allow estimation for hundreds of possible combinations of the predictors.

Models were developed for each employment setting with sufficient responses in the tabulated sample.  City and county planning agencies were further subdivided based on jurisdiction budget.  Within each setting, the models include variables for experience (years in planning field), education (highest degree earned), certification by AICP, and responsibility (number supervised, whether an agency director).  Models are based only on US respondents employed or self-employed full-time/year-round as planners.  (Those not planners but in planning-related positions are excluded this year).  The top and bottom 5% of reported salary values in each setting were censored, to increase prediction reliability.

This worksheet reports on the eight employment settings for which models achieving reasonable levels of explanatory power and statistical significance could be constructed.  Together, these nine settings represent 90% of all APA domestic planners.  (Among the low-prevalence settings not modeled are federal agencies, economic development agencies, nonprofit organizations, educational institutions, law firms, and development firms.)

The models differ in their explanatory power, accounting for between 39% and 53% of the observed variations in salary.  All models are significant by the F-test at p<0.0005, and most variables are significant by the t-test at p<0.05 or better.  Each model's predictive ability varies; predictions will tend to be most accurate for salary values in the middle of the modeled range.

 

employment setting # of cases modeled range   % of variation explained mean predicted salary
city planning agency (<$10M budget) 468 $42,000 $116,400 47.6% $69,830
city planning agency ($10-$99M) 1,214 $48,000 $142,180 46.9% $81,300
city planning agency ($100M+) 855 $48,250 $160,540 53.2% $83,920
county planning agency (<$100M) 521 $40,350 $118,000 48.1% $66,620
county planning agency ($100M+) 387 $50,000 $140,000 42.9% $81,990
metropolitan or regional planning agency 402 $43,000 $138,970 53.4% $72,380
state agency 207 $43,250 $112,970 38.6% $70,480
private consulting firm 1,254 $50,000 $174,300 52.9% $84,960

The statistical conclusions reached through these models must be interpreted carefully. Although a model explaining around half of the variation in salary may be described as moderately powerful, it still leaves nearly half of the variation unexplained. It is certain that other variables not captured through this survey also have an effect on salary levels: individual job performance, to note a particularly important one. To the extent the models do not include all the major determinants of compensation, they should be interpreted cautiously.

This salary worksheet is based on statistical models developed from the APA 2018 Planners Salary Survey. Only domestic individuals employed full-time/year-round as planners, and providing complete information, were included in the analysis.

The models provide moderately powerful predictive accuracy within relatively broad ranges, offering a rough idea of what professionals with similar characteristics and in similar situations earn, on average. Because other factors not included in the models are known to influence salary (for example, individual job performance), this worksheet is not appropriately used as an absolute guideline for any single individual's situation

Select your responses for each variable shown, then click the CALCULATE button below to see what annual salary full-time US planners in similar circumstances earn, on average.

fields.title: AICP Prorated Dues Intro
fields.text:
Take the Last Step to AICP Membership

You passed the AICP Exam! Congratulations!

There is just one more step before you officially join the American Institute of Certified Planners. Your AICP membership ⎯ and authorization to use the AICP designation ⎯ will begin when you have paid AICP Initial Dues.

The amount of your AICP Initial Dues appears below. The amount is prorated to cover your AICP membership through your current APA billing period, which ends on the date shown below. After that, your APA and AICP billing periods will coincide and APA will bill you for both memberships simultaneously.

Your Official Welcome

If you pay your AICP Initial Dues within two months of receiving this notice, APA will automatically send a packet that includes your AICP certificate, lapel pin, and important membership information, including Certification Maintenance requirements. After two months, you must request a packet from AICPexam@planning.org.

We look forward to your joining AICP.

fields.title: logged in, but not a PAN member
fields.text: We're sorry, you must belong to APA and the members-only Planners' Advocacy Network to view that page and other exclusive content. If you are an APA member, you can  join the Planners’ Advocacy Network from My APA. If you are not an APA member, please join us!  We'd love to have you.
